text:
Hi everyone!
we are currently migrating our api from the api key version to the token/prive-app version(<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app>), but we really don't know if we have to migrate somthing in our HubSpot tracking code ('_hsq.push(["identify",{...').
Any suggestion will be appreciated

Hello <@U049DFUK1RB>
Thank you for your reply. I tried going through it, but facing few problems. Can you please provide GET URL to get all partners details.
okay thank you so much <@U01QVR44MEY>
I did’t understand it too :joy::joy::joy:

Hi
We're trying to build a custom integration that allows us to make distribution lists on the fly, but it gets quite messy without moving them into a specific parent folder.
We're using this endpoint: <https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists>
Has anyone had success in passing down a parent folder ID to save the list to? I see in the dashboard it uses a GQL call, but there's no endpoint in the API, and there doesn't seem to be any progress on amending the existing one.
Thanks
Honestly because api keys are being phased out in the next 2 weeks I would just switch to private apps
Of course, let me know how it goes and if you need any help
Of course, let me know how it turns out

Hi all! Currently working on an application which allows data to be saved in a custom object but I am running into a CORS error (Reason: CORS header ‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ missing) and wondering if anyone has come across this? Have been making use of a CORS Anywhere script on Heroku but have run into a rate limiter on cloudflare which has stopped everything working so hoping there is a better solution or someone else has come across this that can point me in the right direction to get it resolved? Im pretty confident I can use serverless functions to handle the API requests for me but ideally would like to avoid this if there is a better solution. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah I really like using lambda functions but really that might just be me
Did this help you get around the CORS issues?
Yeah, I've never had cors issues with lambdas
do you have a link to any documentation i can read up on this?
Im assuming you mean AWS lambda functions as well?
Yep, here's the docs for getting started with HubSpot serverless functions <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-serverless-functions>
and lambdas are just the same thing but with on aws instead of HubSpot
HubSpot functions are just lambda functions
ahhhhhh I see what you mean! That was my backup plan and how I have been able to get around it in the past!
Thanks for your help!
Of course, let me know how it goes
<@U01QVR44MEY> Yes
Hey Zsolt! Are you there and still facing this issue? Happy to meet now and help if that is the case.

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY> ,
can you please help me on the above
Cancelling the auth wouldn't do anything because the app is already installed
but in my case its generating the access token even though if i canceled
yes because even if you cancel that doesn't mean the app uninstalls itself
If you cancel for an app that isn't installed it shouldn't send anything
CANCELLING DOESN'T DO ANYTHING (if the app is already installed)
ok thanks for clarifying , let me do a bit more research and will ping you if anything is required
Yeah, just let me know
Always willing to hop on a call if that will help
yes sure, in which time zone are you in?
CST
You can book a session with the calendar in my bio
cool,

Hey Sarfaraj,

You can use *crm/v3/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}* API to get a specific Partner's data by providing that partner's ID in the request, or you can use */crm/v3/objects/{objectType},*  API to get all the Partner's data by just providing the object ID
